projects.description: Data collection made easy is a web a website helps companies to manage their surveys for their products. We have developed DCME with Susanna Jacob and Nicholas Demils as our final project for Le-Wagoon 9 weeks of coding bootcamp.
Simple and short excersize to practice fetching data.

In this project I created a browser-based, word guessing game. I used JavaScript and OOP (Object-Oriented Programming) to select a random, hidden phrase, which a player tries to guess, by clicking letters on an onscreen keyboard.
In this project, I used a common web development technique known as 'pagination' to enhance the usability of a web page.

In this project I used an API call. I request a JSON object from the API and parse the data so that 12 employees are listed in a grid with their thumbnail image, full name, email, and location. Clicking the employee’s image or name will open a modal window with more detailed information, such as the employee’s birthday and address.

I created an app that displays random famous quotes each time a button is clicked. I have selected and randomly presented quotes from famous historical figures. The array of quote objects is built, to store the quotes. Functions for selecting random quotes from the array and printing them to the screen, are implemented.
In this project, I used JavaScript to enhance an interactive registration form for a fictional conference called FullStack Conf.
